sentences.sContent: In pregnant women with untreated early syphilis, 25% of pregnancies result in stillbirth and 14% in neonatal death – an overall perinatal mortality of about 40%.
sentences.sContent_eng: In pregnant women with untreated early syphilis, 25% of pregnancies result in stillbirth and 14% in neonatal death – an overall perinatal mortality of about 40%.
sentences.sCn: 患有早期梅毒但未经治疗的孕妇，有25%的妊娠结果为死胎，14%为新生儿死亡 − 总的围产儿死亡率约为40%。

sentences.sContent: Arsenic was also widely available at the time, handed out in the form of Fowler's Solution as a treatment for everything from rheumatism – something Austen complained of in her letters – to syphilis.
sentences.sContent_eng: Arsenic was also widely available at the time, handed out in the form of Fowler's Solution as a treatment for everything from rheumatism – something Austen complained of in her letters – to syphilis.
sentences.sCn: 砷在当时以福勒氏溶液（亚砷酸钾溶液）的形式被广泛使用：该溶液被作为一种医治百病的药剂——从风湿病到梅毒——奥斯汀在信中曾抱怨过此事。

sentences.sContent: The study did not include syphilis, gonorrhea or HIV, as earlier studies found very low prevalence of these diseases in this age group.
sentences.sContent_eng: The study did not include syphilis, gonorrhea or HIV, as earlier studies found very low prevalence of these diseases in this age group.
sentences.sCn: 研究内容并不包括梅毒、淋病和艾滋病，正如先前的研究一样：在此年龄组里，以上疾病并不普遍。

trans.tranOther: a very serious disease that is passed from one person to another during sexual activity
